title: N/a
text: It has long hours and you have to be there really early in the morning. But the pay is good but they have a big turn over rate they will lay you off and hire someone else.

title: Great for a first job
text: A lot of ex-military and top tier graduate students, so you could imagine the egos in the room are probably the hardest part about this job. Then comes the ever changing hours and management breathing down your neck. It was fun the first 2-3 years then it became a stress pit, work/life balance was so out of whack that I didn't care about anyone else after I got off work.

title: Over qualified and pigeon holed...
text: I took a $20k/yr paycut to be in the SpaceX team. I was thoroughly challenged, not only in overcoming engineering & manufacturing obstacles, but also in working with others too. You see, their are key people in SpaceX who are greatly over qualified, and approaching these icons with a mind ready for anything is essential, and also being humble to ask honest questions. questionstoo. be

title: Out of this world place to work!
text: Incredible place to be employed to say the least. Everything you need to be wildly successful as a individual as well as a team with one massive collective goal of colonizing Mars.

title: Don’t expect to have much of home life.
text: I loved what I did but if your not one of the managers buddy’s don’t expect to get far. HR is worthless and every 2 to 3 years there is a purge where management gets pay back on employees buy firing them. But walking screw ups that suck up get promoted. That’s why most people don’t last more than a few years.

title: Fast paced, exciting,
text: Space is a great place to work, very busy daily, hardest part of job is lack of communication, leads are too busy to hear employee feedback. The most enjoyable is knowing we make a difference to space exploration

title: Poor management, few perks, HR was a nightmare
text: Any positive culture or great perks advertised was a lie. Work usually required 50+ hours a week and even with that they would tell you it is not adequate. Everyone is so afraid of being fired that they will sacrifice you on every chopping block. There is no guidance or mentorship and one of the people whom I was told to follow in their dedication/professionalism would cry at their desk on a weekly basis.  The team leader and director were lacking and not any real help. Team goals and roadmaps were really just panicking to get each project out the door with no organization to prevent the next shitstorm. Instructions were vague, notes were unhelpful. Compared to other companies I have worked for, it felt like there was no leadership.  HR would not take safety complaints seriously. Also, my experience as well as two friends' experience with HR seemed to be aggressive and we were not heard in any complaints. They also would schedule your meetings without warning.

title: Review summary
text: I enjoy my place of employment I can not complain. The work environment is very fast pace and always changing also competitive and challenging environment.

title: Long hours and amazing builds that you can be part of
text: Be ready to work long hours. Average of 10 hours a day for most. And expect to work on some weekends as well.  Working here is very rewarding but it depends on how you look at it. What we build here is amazing and knowing you are part of it makes it even better. Your friends or people you know are always amazed every time they find out you work at spaceX. Which, in return, makes you feel good.

title: Stay as far away from this company as possible
text: This company could care less for its employees the lack of respect for its employees goes all the way back to the owner I have been in the trade for over 20 years and have never worked for a worse company

title: Ambitious & unorganized
text: The main factor of building rockets and other futuristic things is great. Departmentally, management is too unorganized and plays favorites. The favorites advance and get compensated handsomely. The blue collar class here seem to get less love than engineers. Benefits are better than most places out there. Work life balance is terrible.

title: They canceled our contracts to move to Texas
text: They canceled our contracts to move to Texas  They messed with the schedule every week. Steadily switching from dayshift to night shift and back  You could not make plans to do anything

title: Fun place to work
text: I enjoyed my 5 years with Spacex. There's nothing more exciting than working in the aerospace industry. Especially as busy and fast paced as Spacex is in Cape Canaveral.

title: Long Hours
text: Long Hours. Spacex pay is a bit lower than expected. Overall working many hours is the normal day. Spacex seems to run through many employees as the burn out happens quickly .

title: Great company
text: Can be very overwhelming at times. A lot of hours most of the time. Fast paced. Wage is very good for a new hire and more. Great opportunity for advancement within. Culture is huge.

title: Most rewarding career experience of my life
text: Don’t get me wrong: that place could chew you up and spit you out if you weren’t tough enough or motivated enough. But I accomplished and learned more there than any job and was constantly filled with wonder and awe.

title: Its a great job and place
text: There is never a shortage of work. The people who work there are young and have bright spirits and are always willing to help you. You are almost always set up to succeed.

title: Mind your P's and Q's
text: Walk on egg shells and don't conversate with anyone. Spacex is geared for the younger crowd with no personality. Rat or get ratted on. Too freaking political.

title: Low salary
text: SpaceX had lots of frills such as free coffee soda and ice cream. The pay for my position was very low for the work being done. There was no possible way to afford to live in the area based off the pay for technicians. Coworkers were really nice but there was little to no advancement.

title: Do not recommend!!
text: Really bad management,, This company will go down,, no wonder they are not getting any new contracts. You will be their slave and if that is ok then get a job here!!
